newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador Q1 GDP grows 1.7 pct - central bank source.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador Q1 GDP grows 1.7 pct - central bank source.

text.p: Ecuador's gross domestic product grew 1.7 percent in the first quarter of this year, down from 3.9 percent in the same period of 1995, a top Central Bank source said Tuesday.
The source, who requested anonymity, told Reuters that the political uncertainty on the eve of congressional and presidential elections were partly responsible for the lower rate of growth.
Abdala Bucaram was elected president in July runoff polls.
The government predicts annual growth of 2.9 percent, up from 2.3 percent last year but down from 4.3 percent in 1994.
Growth between January and March was led by the transportation sector, up 4.5 percent, followed by 3.0 percent growth for financial services, trade 2.3 percent and petroleum 2.2 percent.

The manufacturing sector contracted 2.1 percent in the same period, while construction was off 1.4 percent, followed by a 1.3 percent fall for electricity and 1.0 percent for government services, the source said.
In the last quarter of 1995, the Ecuador's GDP fell 0.4 percent.
